patterns: Where are your offices?
Where is KMPDC located?
What is your office address?
Where can I find KMPDC?
responses: KMPDC offices are located along Woodlands Road, off Lenana Road, Nairobi, Kenya.
You can visit us at KMPDC headquarters, Woodlands Road, off Lenana Road, Nairobi.

patterns: Can I send my registration application via email?
Can I apply for registration online?
Is registration submission done by email?
Can I submit my registration documents through email?
responses: Registration applications should be submitted through the KMPDC Online Services Portal. Email submissions are not accepted.
Please use the KMPDC online portal for all registration applications.

patterns: Can someone pick a registration certificate on my behalf?
Can another person collect my certificate?
Is it possible for someone else to pick my registration certificate?
responses: Yes, a representative can collect your certificate on your behalf if they present a signed authorization letter and valid identification.

patterns: How long is the registration process?
How long does registration take?
When will my registration be completed?
responses: The registration process typically takes 2–4 weeks after submission of all required documents and successful verification.

patterns: How long does licensing processing take after registration?
When can I get my license after registration?
How long does it take to process a license?
responses: Licensing usually takes 2–3 weeks after registration approval and payment confirmation.

patterns: Can a foreign doctor practice in Kenya for a short time?
Can foreign doctors work in Kenya temporarily?
Are short-term foreign practitioners allowed?
responses: Yes, foreign doctors may apply for a temporary license to practice in Kenya for a specific duration or assignment, subject to KMPDC approval.

patterns: What is the status of my cases?
Can you update me on my case?
How can I check the progress of my complaint or case?
responses: You can check the status of your case through the KMPDC online portal or by contacting the Legal Department for updates.

patterns: Assist me to access my online account?
I can’t log in to my KMPDC account
Help me with my KMPDC account login
responses: Please use the ‘Forgot Password’ option on the KMPDC Online Services Portal. If the issue persists, contact ICT support via support@kmpdc.go.ke.

patterns: I need to change my online email?
How can I update my KMPDC portal email?
Can I change my registered email address?
responses: To change your registered email, send a formal request to ICT support at support@kmpdc.go.ke, including your full name and registration details.

patterns: My CPD points are not reflecting?
Why are my CPD points missing?
CPD points not updated on my profile?
responses: CPD points may take a few days to update after provider submission. If not reflected, please confirm with your CPD provider or email cpd@kmpdc.go.ke.

patterns: I do not have enough points to renew my license?
Can I renew my license without full CPD points?
What happens if I lack required CPD points?
responses: You must attain the required CPD points before renewal. Please complete additional accredited CPD activities to meet the renewal criteria.

patterns: I have a penalty on my invoice, can this be removed?
Can my penalty charge be waived?
Is it possible to remove my late payment penalty?
responses: Penalty removal is subject to KMPDC management approval. Please submit a written request explaining the reason for delay.

patterns: How can I change my license from non-clinical to clinical?
Can I switch from non-clinical to clinical practice?
Change my license category to clinical
responses: You can request a license type change by submitting supporting documentation through the KMPDC portal and notifying the Licensing Department.

patterns: How can I update the credentials on my licence?
I need to add qualifications to my license
Update my professional details on license
responses: To update credentials, submit your new academic or professional documents through the KMPDC portal for verification and license update.

patterns: Can I do my internship in Kenya as a foreigner?
Are foreigners allowed to do internship in Kenya?
Foreign trained doctor internship in Kenya
responses: Yes, foreign-trained doctors can apply for internship placement in Kenya through KMPDC, subject to eligibility and verification.

patterns: As a foreign trained Kenyan is the internship in my country of training valid for registration purposes?
Is foreign internship valid for registration?
Can my foreign internship count for registration?
responses: Internships completed abroad are assessed individually. KMPDC determines their validity based on duration, scope, and accreditation of the training institution.

patterns: How does the balloting process for internship centre happen?
How are internship centres assigned?
Explain internship balloting process
responses: Internship centres are allocated through an electronic balloting system managed by KMPDC to ensure fairness and transparency.

patterns: Can I change my internship centre?
How do I request a change of internship centre?
Is it possible to transfer internship hospital?
responses: Requests to change internship centres must be submitted formally to KMPDC, stating valid reasons. Approval is subject to availability and justification.
